Database
  • Introduction
  • SQL vs. NoSQL
  • Document database (Mongodb)

  1. Introduction

    Database: SQL, NoSQL. ACID (atomicity, consistency, isolation, durability)

    transaction

  2. SQL vs NoSQL

    SQL

    Stored structured information: data organized as rows that stored in a table

    1. MySQL
    2. Oracle Database
    3. PostgreSQL

    NoSQL

    No object-relation mapping required

    + Easy for distributed
    + Parition tolerance (CAP???)
    + Consistency
    + Scalability
    + Avaliablity

    There are different types of NoSQL database

    1. Mongodb: document database
    2. Redis: key-value database
    3. Cassandra: Column-family database
    4. Neo4J: graph database

  3. Document database (Mongodb)

    Document

    A document is a self-contained piece of information, the format of a document can be JSON string, XML string??

    * Mongodb is good at storing JSON document.

    Organization

    Database (SQL Database) -> Collection (SQL Table)-> Document (SQL Row)

    Different from SQL, the documents are not structured. For example, {"name":"Nan", "age":24} and {"temperature":34, "humidity":23} can be stored in one collection.
